skill.name: skill-creator
skill.description: Guide for creating effective skills. This skill should be used when users want to create a new skill (or update an existing skill) that extends Claude's capabilities with specialized knowledge, workflows, or tool integrations.
skill.summary: Guide for creating effective skills. This skill should be used when users want to create a new skill...
skill.author: Joseph OBrien

security_audit.summary: Documentation and scaffolding skill with Python helper scripts. Scripts perform standard file operations (validation, initialization, packaging) using only Python standard library. No network access, credential reading, or code execution capabilities beyond intended purpose.

content.value_statement: Creating effective AI skills from scratch requires understanding modular design, proper structure, and reusable resources. This skill provides a step-by-step process for building skills that extend Claude with specialized knowledge and automated workflows.
actual_capabilities: Guide the skill creation process from concept to packaged skill
Create skill directory structures with proper SKILL.md format
Validate skill frontmatter and naming conventions
Package skills into distributable zip files
Provide reference templates for agent and subagent skills
limitations: Does not execute arbitrary code or perform task automation
Does not integrate with external APIs or services
Does not provide pre-built domain expertise (only guidance)
Requires user to supply skill-specific content and logic

use_cases.title: Build reusable skills
use_cases.description: Package domain expertise into shareable skills that extend Claude capabilities across your team

use_cases.title: Create documentation skills
use_cases.description: Build skills that encode company documentation, style guides, and reference materials for consistent output

use_cases.title: Standardize workflows
use_cases.description: Create skills that enforce team processes, coding standards, and review procedures automatically

prompt_templates.title: New skill from scratch
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me create a new skill called [skill-name] for [use case]. Walk me through the skill creation process step by step.

prompt_templates.title: Package existing skill
prompt_templates.prompt: I have a skill folder at [path]. Validate it and package it for distribution using the packaging script.

prompt_templates.title: Add resources to skill
prompt_templates.prompt: My [existing-skill] needs a script for [specific task]. Help me determine if I should add it to scripts, references, or assets.

prompt_templates.title: Structure complex skill
prompt_templates.prompt: I want to create a skill that handles [multiple use cases]. Help me structure the SKILL.md using the progressive disclosure design pattern.

output_examples.input: Help me create a skill for reviewing API documentation
output: Step 1: Identify concrete examples of API review tasks
Step 2: Plan reusable resources (scripts, references, assets)
Step 3: Initialize skill structure with init_skill.py
Step 4: Add reference documentation for API formats
Step 5: Validate and package the skill

best_practices: Use third-person description format starting with 'This skill should be used when...' for clear trigger conditions
Keep SKILL.md lean under 5k words and move detailed documentation to references/ files
Include concrete examples with realistic user prompts to guide skill behavior
anti_patterns: Including placeholder text in final skills reduces clarity and reliability
Duplicating information between SKILL.md and references/ wastes context space
Using generic descriptions instead of specific triggers causes skills to activate inappropriately

faq.question: What platforms support this skill?
faq.answer: Works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. Each platform can load skills to extend base capabilities.

faq.question: How large can a skill become?
faq.answer: SKILL.md body stays under 5k words. Reference files are unlimited since scripts can execute without loading context.

faq.question: Can skills call external APIs?
faq.answer: Skills provide guidance only. API integration requires bundled scripts or MCP tool definitions within the skill.

faq.question: Is data from skills stored anywhere?
faq.answer: Skills are pure configuration. No data is stored or transmitted. All processing happens at runtime.

faq.question: Why does my skill validation fail?
faq.answer: Check frontmatter for required name and description fields. Names must use hyphen-case (lowercase with hyphens).

faq.question: How is this different from MCP tools?
faq.answer: Skills encode knowledge and workflows. MCP tools provide executable capabilities. Skills guide Claude on how to use tools.
